intro: Pilosella hoppeana subsp. testimonialis, commonly known as the alpine mouse-ear, is a flowering plant native to high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its small, hairy leaves and yellow composite flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in cool, moist conditions. Its subspecies status reflects its distinct ecological and morphological traits compared to other Pilosella species. It plays a role in stabilizing soil in its harsh habitat and is of interest to botanists studying alpine flora.
